info.description:
Tugas Besar Pemrograman Berbasis Platform  
Topik: Tokopedia  
Anggota Kelompok:

**1122004 - William Frederick Iversen**

**1122007 - Waluya Juang Husada**

**1122013 - Peter Kurniawan Oktavianus**

**1122018 - Irvan**

**1122026 - Steve Agustinus**

**1122052 - Nathanael Timothius Sutedja**

item.name: Cart
Shipment

request.description: ### Request - Method: `PUT` - Endpoint: `/api/cart/:id_user/change_shipment_address` The request will contain the following fields: 1. `"id_address"`: This field serves as a unique identifier for the address entry, distinguishing it from other addresses. 2. `"no_telephone"`: This field contains the telephone number associated with the address. 3. `"address_label"`: This field provides a label or name for the address, indicating its purpose or type (e.g., home, office). 4. `"address"`: This field specifies the street address where the location is physically situated. 5. `"address_province"`: Indicates the province or administrative region where the address is located. 6. `"address_country"`: Specifies the country of the address. 7. `"address_district"`: Represents the district or local administrative division within the province. 8. `"address_postal_code"`: Contains the postal code or ZIP code for the address, used for mail delivery and sorting. 9. `"notes"`: Provides space for additional comments or notes related to the address. 10. `"pinpoint"`: Contains geographic coordinates (latitude and longitude) pinpointing the exact location on Earth's surface. ### Response The request will contain the following fields: 1. `"success"`: This field indicates whether the operation (updating the address) was successful or not. A value of `true` means that the address was updated successfully without encountering any errors. 2. `"message"`: This field provides a message or description related to the outcome of the operation. In this case, it confirms that the address was updated successfully, providing feedback to the user or system about the result of the operation.

query.description: set the user id

request.description: The Add Multiple Shipments endpoint allows users to add multiple shipment addresses to their shopping cart for a specific user identified by `id_user`. This is particularly useful for orders that require shipping to different locations or multiple recipients. ### Request - Method: `POST` - Endpoint: `/api/cart/:id_user/shipment/add_multiple_shipments` The request will contain the following fields: 1. `"shops"`: This field contains an array of shops, each representing a different seller or store. - `"shop_name"`: The name of the shop or seller. - `"shop_status"`: Indicates the status of the shop, such as "official_store" in this case. - `"shop_location"`: Specifies the location of the shop, such as "Jakarta Utara" (North Jakarta) in this example. Within each shop, there are details about the products being shipped: - `"products"`: An array of products available in the shop. - `"id_product"`: The unique identifier for the product. - `"product_name"`: The name or title of the product. - `"has_variants"`: Indicates whether the product has variants or options. - `"variants"`: An array containing details about product variants if applicable. - `"price"`: The price of the product. - `"notes"`: Additional notes or comments related to the product. - `"is_product_checked"`: A boolean value indicating if the product is selected or checked in the cart. - `"is_wishlist"`: A boolean value indicating if the product is in the wishlist. For each product, there are one or more shipments associated with it: - `"shipments"`: An array of shipments for the product. - `"id_address"`: The unique identifier for the shipping address. - `"address_title"`: A title or label for the shipping address (e.g., "Rumah Utama" for "Main House"). - `"address_name"`: The name associated with the shipping address. - `"address"`: The detailed address including street, city, and region. - `"customer_telephone_number"`: The telephone number of the customer associated with the address. - `"quantity"`: The quantity of the product to be shipped to this address. ### Response The response will contain the following fields: - `"success": true`: This field indicates whether the operation (in this case, adding an address) was successful or not. A value of `true` means that the address was added successfully without any errors. - `"message": "Address added successfully"`: This field provides a message or description related to the operation's outcome. In this case, it confirms that the address was added successfully, providing feedback to the user or system about the result of the operation.

query.description: set the user id

item.description: The Shipment endpoint allows users to manage the shipment details related to their shopping cart. This includes changing the shipment address for an order, adding multiple shipment addresses to the cart, and retrieving shipment information.

request.description: This endpoint retrieves the cart details for a specific user identified by the `user_id`. The response will include the shop name, shop status, whether the shop is checked, a list of products including their names, quantities, prices, and notes, and a flag indicating if the items are in the wishlist. ### Request - Method: `GET` - Endpoint: `/api/cart/:id_user` ### Response The response will contain the following fields: - `shop_name` (string): The name of the shop where the products are sourced from. - `shop_status` (string): The status of the shop, indicating if it's an official store or not. - `is_shop_checked` (boolean): Indicates whether the shop is checked or selected in the context of an action or operation. - `quantity` (number): The quantity of products being processed or added. - `products` (array): An array containing details of the products available in the shop, with each product having the following fields: - `id_product` (number): The unique identifier for the product. - `product_name` (string): The name or title of the product. - `has_variants` (boolean): Indicates if the product has variants or options. - `variants` (array): An array containing details of the variants available for the product, if any. - `color` (string): The color variant of the product. - `quantity` (number): The quantity of this specific product being processed or added. - `price` (number): The price of the product. - `notes` (string): Additional notes or instructions related to the product. - `is_product_checked` (boolean): Indicates whether the product is checked or selected in the context of an action or operation. - `is_wishlist` (boolean): Indicates if the product is added to the wishlist or not.

query.description: set the user id

request.description: This endpoint retrieves the total price and total items in the cart for a specific user. ### Request - Method: `GET` - Endpoint: `/api/cart/:user_id/total_cart` ### Response The response will contain the following fields: - `price_total` (number): The total price of all items in the cart. - `cart_total` (number): The total quantity of all checked items in the cart. #### Example ``` json { "price_total": 0, "cart_total": 0 } ```

query.description: set the user id

request.description: ### Request - Method: PATCH - Endpoint: `/api/cart/:id_user/add_quantity` The request will contain the following fields: 1. `id_user (number)`: This field represents the unique identifier (ID) of a user who has the cart. It is typically a numeric value used to distinguish one user from another within a system or database. 2. `id_product (number)`: This field represents the unique identifier (ID) of a product that was updated in the cart. Each product in a system is assigned a specific ID to differentiate it from other products. 3. `quantity (number)`: This field indicates the total quantity of a specific product that was updated in the cart. It represents the number of units or items of that product that are now in the cart after the update. ### Response The response will contain the following fields: - `success:` This field indicates whether the operation (updating the quantity) was successful or not. A value of `true` means that the quantity was updated successfully without any errors. - `message`: This field provides a message or description related to the outcome of the operation. In this case, it confirms that the quantity was updated successfully in the cart, providing feedback to the user or system about the result of the operation.

query.description: set the user id

item.description: The Cart API Endpoint allows users to manage their shopping cart, including get all the cart's products list, get the cart's total price and quantity, adding quantity, add multiple shipment in cart's checkout, and changing shipment address.

item.name: Homepage
Top Up & Bill

query.description: mobile phone number to which the credit will be added
the amount of credit to be added

request.description: The "Add Pulsa" API allows users to add mobile phone credit (pulsa) to a specified telephone number. This API requires two parameters: 1. **telephone_number**: This parameter specifies the mobile phone number to which the credit (pulsa) will be added. 2. **amount**: This parameter indicates the amount of credit (pulsa) to be added to the specified telephone number. Users can use this API by providing the telephone number and the desired amount of credit they wish to add. The API will then process the request and add the specified credit to the designated phone number.

query.description: type of electricity product or service associated with the bill payment
meter number associated with the electricity account for which the bill payment is intended.
amount of the electricity bill to be paid.

request.description: The "PLN Electricity Bill" API enables users to pay their electricity bills conveniently through an automated system. This API requires three parameters: 1. **product_type**: This parameter specifies the type of electricity product or service associated with the bill payment (e.g. "Token Listrik", "Tagihan Listrik", "PLN Non-Taglis"). 2. **no_meter**: This parameter represents the meter number associated with the electricity account for which the bill payment is intended. 3. **amount**: This parameter indicates the amount of the electricity bill to be paid. Users can use this API by providing the product type, meter number, and the amount they wish to pay. The API will process the request and facilitate the payment of the specified electricity bill accordingly.

item.description: A feature in Tokoepdia's homepage that use for paying bill and buying credit, and others.

request.description: The "Choice Category" API is a GET API that allows users to retrieve a list of available categories to choose from. This API does not require any parameters; instead, it returns a list of categories that users can select from.

The "Special Discount" API is a GET API that provides access to special discount offers or promotions available within a system or platform. This API allows users to retrieve information about ongoing discounts.

The "Trending Product" API is a GET API that enables users to retrieve a list of currently trending or popular products within a specified system or platform. This API does not require any parameters; instead, it returns a curated list of products that are currently gaining attention or popularity based on user interactions, sales, or other metrics.

item.description: A landing page for Tokopedia's homepage would typically showcase a vibrant array of featured products, promotions, and categories to entice visitors and guide them towards exploring the platform's offeringsEndFragment

request.description: Add the product to user's cart when user clicks "+ Keranjang" button. Required field: - id_product: Product ID - variants (if the product has variants) - amount
Remove the selected product from user's wishlist when the active heart button clicked. Required fields: - id_product: Product ID - product variants (if the product has variants)

This request is aimed to submit a product review to the system. The review details include the seller's name, the date the order was received, product details (including product ID, product name, quality rating, and review text), and instructions on how to display it. The request is sent using the HTTP POST method to the `/api/reviews` endpoint. Authorization is performed by including a token in the request header. - The `seller` field specifies the seller's name (e.g., ACE Indonesia). - The `received_date` field indicates the date the order was received (e.g., 14 Feb 2024, 11:24 WIB). - The `product_id` field denotes the ID of the product being reviewed (e.g., 24). - The `name` field represents the name of the product (e.g., Krisbow Gembok Dengan Alarm - Black). - The `quality_rating` field allows the user to rate the quality of the product (1-5). - The `review` field contains the textual review provided by the user (e.g., Excellent). - The `show_as` field specifies how the review should be displayed. Choose "show profile" to display the profile to all users, or choose "hide profile" to display the profile only to the seller. - Users can also include multiple photos of the product by attaching them as multipart/form-data with keys `photo_1`, `photo_2`, `photo_3`, and so on. These photo fields are optional.

This API endpoint allows users to edit an existing review. Users can update the review details including the seller, received date, product details, attached photos, and how the review should be displayed. The review to be edited is identified by `:review_id` parameter in the URL path. Upon receiving a valid request, the server will update the review information with the provided data. The updated review will then be reflected in the system. The response will indicate the success or failure of the operation, along with any relevant details.

Post a report on a product that violates rules by filling out the required documents according to its violation category. Required fields: - id_user: User ID that files the report - id_category: Category ID - 1: "Pelanggaran HAKI & Produk MLM" - 2: "Harga Tidak Wajar" - sub-category: Select one of the following sub-category ID - 1: "Indikasi Penipuan" - 2: "Harga tidak sesuai standar" - 3: "Indikasi manipulasi" - message: Detailed reason about the violation - imgs: Array of string. Each item would be an image string - 3: "Produk Dewasa & Pornografi" - sub-category: Select one of the following sub-category ID - 1: "Gambar produk sensual" - 2: "Obat untuk aktivitas seksual" - 3: "Gambar menyerupai alat vital" - 4: "Mengandung unsur pornografi" - message: Detailed reason about the violation - 4: "Produk Ilegal, Palsu, dan Berbahaya" - sub-category: Select one of the following sub-category ID - 1: "Obat, vitamin, atau kosmetik berbahaya" - 2: "Materai" - 3: "Senjata" - 4: "Dokumen resmi" - 5: "Minuman beralkohol" - 6: "Hewan" - 7: "Produk non-fisik" - 8: "Tiket pertunjukan" - 9: "Produk mistis" - 10: "Uang tunai" - 11: "Bahan peledak" - 12: "Narkotika" - message: Detailed reason about the violation - 5: "Salah Kategori" - message: Detailed reason about the violation - 6: "Duplikasi Produk Tanpa Izin - message: Detailed reason about the violation - links: Array of string. Each item would be a link reffering to the original product - 7: "Spam Produk" - message: Detailed reason about the violation - links: Array of string. Each item would be a link reffering to the identical product - 8: "Promosi Pihak / Produk Lain - sub-category: Select one of the following sub-category ID - 1: "Berupa testimoni" - 2: "Iklan ke situs / toko lain" - 3: "Menawarkan jasa" - 4: "Judul tidak relevan" - message: Detailed reason about the violation - 9: "Produk Tembakau dan Rokok Relektrik - message: Detailed reason about the violation - 10: "Label Halal MUI di Produk yang Salah" - message: Detailed reason about the violation - 11: "Produk Melebihi Rujuakna Batas Pembelian terkait COVID-19" - message: Detailed reason about the violation - 12: "Tidak sesuai untuk Bangga Buatan Indonesia" - message: Detailed reason about the violation - 13: "Video Produk Melanggar Syarat dan Ketentuan Tokopedia - message: Detailed reason about the violation - imgs: Array of string. Each item would be an image string - 14: "Stok Produk Kosong" - message: Detailed reason about the violation - imgs: Array of string. Each item would be an image string - 15: "Produk Vitamin, Obat-obatan, atau Alat Kesehatan Palsu" - message: Detailed reason about the violation - imgs: Array of string. Each item would be an image string - 16: "Indikasi Manipulasi Berat" - message: Detailed reason about the violation - 17: "Pakaian Bekas dan Aksesoris Pakaian Bekas Lainnya - message: Detailed reason about the violation - is_data_authentic: Authenticity of input must be true

request.description: The 'Get Seller Account' API retrieves the account information of a seller based on the provided seller ID. By sending a GET request to the endpoint with the seller's unique identifier as a parameter, users can access details such as the seller's username, role, delivery address, current balance, and any credit for top advertisements. This API facilitates the retrieval of seller account data, enabling seamless integration with e-commerce platforms and applications.

The 'Get All Product' API allows users to retrieve all products associated with a specific seller by providing the seller's unique identifier as a parameter. By sending a GET request to the endpoint with the seller ID, users can obtain a comprehensive list of products offered by the seller, including details such as product names, categories, prices, availability, and other relevant information. This API facilitates the seamless retrieval of product data for a particular seller, enabling integration with various e-commerce platforms and applications.

The 'Edit Seller Account' API enables users to update the account information of a seller by specifying the seller's unique identifier as a parameter. By sending a PUT request to the endpoint with the seller ID, users can modify various aspects of the seller's account, such as username, delivery address, contact information, or any other relevant details. This API empowers users to seamlessly manage and update seller account information, facilitating smooth operation and customization within e-commerce platforms and applications.

request.description: The 'Insert Product' API allows users to add a new product to the platform's inventory. By sending a POST request to the designated endpoint, users can provide the necessary product details, including name, category, price, availability, and any additional information. This API facilitates the seamless addition of new products to the platform, enabling sellers to expand their offerings and providing customers with a wider selection of goods.

The 'Delete Product' API enables users to remove a product from the platform's inventory. By sending a DELETE request to the specified endpoint with the product's unique identifier as a parameter, users can initiate the deletion process. This API provides a streamlined method for sellers or administrators to manage their product listings, ensuring accuracy and relevance in the platform's catalog.

Filtering by product type : semua produk (default), belanja, top-up & tagihan, travel & entertainment, keuangan, PLUS, Tokopedia NOW!, GoFood, Lainnya.

request.description: This request retrieves all transactions for a specific user with ID "user123". It's made to the `/api/user/:id_user/transaction` endpoint, where `:id_user` is replaced with the user ID. The server responds with all transactions associated with the user, sorted in descending order by default. All transactions are included without any filtering based on status, product type, transaction date, or search criteria.

request.description: This request retrieves the order detail for a specific user with ID and a particular invoice number . The request is made to the `/api/user/:id_user/order_detail/:invoice` endpoint, where `:id_user` is replaced with the user ID and `:invoice` is replaced with the invoice number. The server responds with detailed information about the order, including transaction status, transaction date, product type, product name, payment details, destination number, amount, payment method, and total payment.
